title: Expert Tips for Teachers When Schools Reopen
description: If you're a teacher expected to return to the classroom soon, these tips can help keep you safe.

title: CDC Says Schools Can Safely Reopen, But Will They?
description: The agency says that it’s been shown that schools can reopen safely if they follow strict mitigation strategies,” whether or not teachers and staff have received the COVID-19 vaccine. But, the agency also urges states and local communities to prioritize educators for vaccines as soon as supplies allow it.

title: Is Any Amount of Coffee Safe for Baby During Pregnancy?
description: New research finds too much coffee during pregnancy could lead to kids with behavior problems later on.

title: Southern California Is Origin of New COVID-19 Variant
description: A new variant of COVID-19 found in Southern California is coursing across the United States and around the world, a new study finds.

title: Healthier 2021: Mark Is Facing His Feelings
description: I've been a bit more emotional than normal. It's disheartening to do all the work and not see it reflected on the scale.

title: Give Hospitalized COVID-19 Patients Blood Thinners
description: Giving blood thinners to COVID-19 patients soon after they're hospitalized could reduce their risk of dying.

title: COVID Vaccine Reaction Can Mimic Breast Cancer Symptoms
description: Both the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines can cause lymph nodes to swell, particularly those in the armpit on the side where the shot was received, experts say.

title: How Families Cope When Only One Gets COVID Vaccine
description: The complicated rollout of the coronavirus vaccines, which remain in limited supply, has created millions of households where one person has been vaccinated but the others have not.

title: Prior Exposure to Common Cold Won't Shield You From COVID
description: A bout of the common cold won't protect you against the new coronavirus infection, researchers report.

title: You've Had COVID: 1 Vaccine Dose May Be Enough
description: New, small studies found patients previously infected with COVID who were given their first vaccine dose showed the sort of robust immune response that people tend to have following their second "booster" dose.

title: COVID Quarantines Not Necessary for Vaccinated People
description: Fully vaccinated Americans can now skip quarantines if they are exposed to someone infected with COVID-19, new federal guidelines say.

title: Walmart, Walgreens, CVS to Offer COVID-19 Vaccines
description: Walmart, Sam’s Club, and Walgreens will begin offering COVID-19 vaccines on Friday through the Federal Retail Pharmacy Program, joining a list of other national retail chains that will give shots to people who want a coronavirus vaccine.CVS Health will also offer vaccinations on Friday in 11 states, with the scheduling system slated to open on Thursday.

title: Anxiety About DVT? Here’s What to Know
description: Here’s what you can do to reduce your blood clot risk -- and try to worry about it less.

title: CDC: Proper Double-Masking Raises COVID Protection
description: Researchers found that if two people are both wearing surgical masks that are knotted and tucked flush to the face -- or if both are wearing a cloth mask over a surgical mask -- exposure to viral particles is cut by more than 95%.

title: The Emotional Side of Breast Cancer
description: Breast cancer can bring on many emotions in people. From diagnosis to treatments, the journey may leave you feeling things you hadn't expected.

title: Obesity Helps Drive Half of New Diabetes Cases
description: Obesity is the culprit in up to half of new diabetes cases among Americans each year, a new study estimates.

title: Healthier 2021: These Hacks Are Helping Bill Control His Eating
description: I love the taste of food, and that’s not going to miraculously change. So, I found a couple of tricks to help me resist the temptation to overeat.

title: Too Much Light at Night May Raise Odds for Thyroid Cancer
description: A new study ties an overabundance of nighttime artificial light with an elevated risk of thyroid cancer.

title: Child Suicides Rising During Lockdown
description: Parents really need to be on the lookout for one in particular: an increased risk of suicide among vulnerable teens.

title: Did the New Coronavirus Come From Pangolins?
description: Could it be that a strange-looking creature known as a pangolin was the conduit by which the new coronavirus jumped to humans and prompted an international pandemic?

title: Experts Debunk COVID-19 Vaccine-Shingles Link
description: Cases of shingles appearing are not surprising during the pandemic, but there's no evidence they are linked to the COVID-19 vaccine.

title: Beyond COVID-19: Can mRNA Treat Diseases, Too?
description: The safety and effectiveness of the new vaccines, and the breakneck speed at which they were developed, have spotlighted the potential for other medicinal uses of mRNA. And the future looks promising.

title: Add Gum Disease to List of Risk Factors for Severe COVID-19
description: A new study finds that gum disease may raise the chances of hospitalization or death if COVID-19 strikes.

title: Daily Coffee Tied to Lower Risk for Heart Failure
description: Having one or more cups of caffeinated coffee a day may reduce your risk of heart failure, new research suggests.

title: Neanderthal Poop Shows Clues to Humans' Microbiome
description: Poop from ancient Neanderthals harbors valuable information about modern-day gut health.

title: High BP at Night, Alzheimer's Risk May Rise, Too
description: Older men whose blood pressure rises at night may be at increased risk for Alzheimer's disease, a new study suggests.

title: With COVID Vaccine Restricted, Line Jumpers Sneak In
description: While some Americans are volunteering to help in any way they can, the urge to jump the line is strong for many.

title: Bans on Evictions, Utility Shutoffs Curb COVID Infections
description: Over the first nine months of the pandemic, the study found, U.S. counties with those policies reduced COVID-19 infection rates by about 4%.

title: Survey: Many Will Keep Precautions After Pandemic
description: Wearing masks, frequent hand-washing and avoiding large crowds -- those habits are likely to stick around for a while, new research suggests.

title: Healthier 2021: Laura's Lifting Weights!
description: Lifting weights at the gym was intimidating, but my health coach helped me set some goals and get motivated.

title: Kids Who Got Flu Shot Had Milder COVID Symptoms
description: Those who had their current flu shot were less likely to have COVID-19 symptoms, respiratory problems or severe illness, University of Missouri researchers said.

title: Common Prostate Drug May Help Prevent Parkinson's
description: New research shows an association between a drug for an enlarged prostate condition and a reduced risk of developing the illness.

title: Government Seeking  More Rapid COVID-19 Tests
description: The Biden administration is pushing to make quick at-home tests for COVID-19 available to more Americans.

title: Doctors: Don’t Make Game Day ‘Superspreader Sunday’
description: Medical professionals are pleading with the public to stay physically distanced and keep gatherings virtual this Sunday. Otherwise, there could be renewed spikes in COVID-19 cases -- a particularly alarming prospect given the new strains that have cropped up.

title: Are COVID Deaths the Result of 'Social Murder'?
description: An editorial in an influential British medical journal says politicians who didn’t respond aggressively enough to control the coronavirus pandemic should be held responsible for those deaths, which the editorial says could be classified as “social murder.”

title: Many Adults Don't Get Enough Fruits, Vegetables
description: A new survey sheds light on how much veggies and fruits U.S. adults say they eat each day.

title: Why 2 COVID Vaccine Doses Are Needed
description: Some question whether the United States would be better off simply trying to give a single dose to as many people as possible.

title: Healthier 2021: Mark Gives Yoga Another Try
description: If you've been following my fitness journey, you know about my struggles with flexibility and my desire to overcome them. So, I’m giving yoga another shot.

title: Very Little Spread of COVID at Kids' Day Camps
description: Day camps could be considered breeding grounds for coronavirus infection, but a new study shows that when social distancing measures are followed, few illnesses result.

title: J&J Seeks Emergency Approval of COVID Vaccine
description: The world's first single-dose COVID-19 vaccine, from Johnson & Johnson, has been submitted to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for emergency use approval.

title: Climate Change May Have Helped COVID-19 Emerge
description: It's a link few might have considered, but a new study indicates that climate change may have prompted the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Study: Young COVID Survivors Can Get Reinfected
description: Being infected with the virus that causes COVID-19 is not a foolproof shield against reinfection, a small preliminary study warns.

title: CDC: Schools Safe to Reopen Before Vaccinations
description: CDC Director Rochelle Walensky, MD, says it’s possible for schools to reopen safely even if teachers have not yet had a chance to be vaccinated.

title: Congressional panel: Toxic Metals Found in Baby Foods
description: The investigators found significantly high levels of arsenic, lead, mercury and cadmium in several major brands of baby food.

title: The Mental Health Toll of Keeping Schools Closed
description: WebMD's Dr. Hansa Bhargava shares why she believes it's urgent that children return to in-person school .

title: Whole Wheat Is Better for You Than White Bread
description: New research reinforces advice to include more whole grains in your diet.

title: How to Tell Someone That You Have Breast Cancer
description: Breaking the news of a breast cancer diagnosis can be tough. Get ideas about how to start the conversation with your family and friends.

title: Green Tea, Coffee May Help You Avoid a 2nd Heart Attack
description: Research adds to evidence that plant compounds called flavonoids are good for cardiovascular health.

title: Grassroots Efforts Help People Get COVID Vaccines
description: Inoculating millions of people is an enormous undertaking, much more complex than a flu vaccine clinic. And not just anybody can give vaccines -- it requires training.

title: Breast Cancer Now the Leading Cancer Diagnosis
description: Breast cancer has surpassed lung cancer as the world's most commonly diagnosed cancer.
